result.execSummary:
The defendant Julie A. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probtion today September 20, 2016 by 1:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 45 days jail credit if revoked.

 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.
DNA surcharge.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample at the St. Croix County Jail.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Travis Newell or the confidential informant.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Julie A. Schmidt appeared. Case called at 9:42 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a final pre trial. ADA Minser states there is a resolution. Recites agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 14CF121. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 14CF121.  Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

-    S/W 3 years probation. Report to probation no later than 1 p.m. today. Bond will remain in effect until reports to probation. 45 days jail credit if revoked.  

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-  DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00

-  Court costs of $268.00. Bond to apply. 

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Travis Newell or the confidential informant.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Julie A. Schmidt appeared from jail. Case called at 3:28 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a pre trial conference. Court received request from DE requesting bond modification. Atty Petros makes statement. Requesting bond modification to $200 cash. ADA McKinley objects to bond modification. Court reviews file. Court denies motion to modify bond at this time. Parties will schedule trial with judicial assistant. Atty Petros makes a speedy trial demand. Final pre trial to also be set. All final pre trial motions to be filed 10 days prior to final pre trial.
